pt: {sc}shrewd{/sc} {sc}sagacious{/sc} {sc}perspicacious{/sc} {sc}astute{/sc} mean acute in perception and sound in judgment. {sc}shrewd{/sc} stresses practical, hardheaded cleverness and judgment.

pt.t: {it}sagacious{/it} investors got in on the ground floor

pt: {sc}perspicacious{/sc} implies unusual power to see through and understand what is puzzling or hidden.

pt.t: a {it}perspicacious{/it} counselor saw through the child's facade

pt: {sc}astute{/sc} suggests shrewdness, perspicacity, and diplomatic skill.

quotes.t: It has been suggested that we go to sleep at night because it is then too dark to do anything else; but owls, who are a venerably {qword}sagacious{/qword} folk, do not sleep in the night-time.
It has allowed him to pre-empt conservative political attacks, to appear {qword}sagacious{/qword} despite his inexperience …
With commendably {qword}sagacious{/qword} foresight, I sneaked spoils as well to the elders of key Judean cities whose good will I was cultivating for the future …
… the winner is praised for his {qword}sagacious{/qword} grasp of the hopes and anxieties of the public, the loser is excoriated for the many and obvious blunders that derailed his candidacy …

et: Latin {it}sagac-, sagax{/it}, from {it}sagire{/it} to perceive keenly; akin to Latin {it}sagus{/it} prophetic {ma}{mat|seek|}{/ma}
shortdef: of keen and farsighted penetration and judgment : discerning
caused by or indicating acute discernment
